• Encrypted email that's private by default.

    Your calendar is a record of your life. Keep it safe.

    Secure cloud storage that gives you control of your data.

    Your gateway to online freedom.

    (new window)

    An encrypted password manager that protects your online identity.

    Improve the security of your business and comply with data protection laws.

  • About us

    Proton stands for privacy. Always has, always will.

    Team

    Meet the people building a better internet.

    Impact

    Defending freedom through tech is why we exist.

    Careers We're hiring

    Seeking talented people to take Proton to the next level.

    We've always been guided by the Proton community.

    Community

    Join the fight to make the internet a better place.

    Open source

    Everyone is welcome to inspect our code. We're open.

    Proton Foundation

    Our non-profit model puts people before profit.

Get help

    1. Support
    2. Proton Account
    3. Get help

    How to change language setting in Proton Mail? | Proton

    A simple and quick guide on how to change the language settings in Proton Mail Account in the web app, Android and iOS. Check step-by-step instructions now!

    1. Support
    2. Proton Account
    3. Get help

    How to report a bug using our web app

    If you've found a bug in Proton Mail, you can report it directly to us in the Proton Mail web app. Learn how.

    1. Support
    2. Proton Account
    3. Get help

    How to take a screenshot

    When sending a bug report via Proton Mail for web or mobile browser, you can add a screenshot that shows the issue you are experiencing. There are multiple ways to take a screenshot depending on the operating system you are using. These are a few suggestions.

    1. Support
    2. Proton Account
    3. Get help

    Proton support and Zendesk

    To meet the needs of our growing customer base, Proton Mail works with Zendesk to quickly and efficiently answer your support needs.

    1. Support
    2. Proton Account
    3. Get help
    4. Sign up and login issues

    Common login problems with your Proton Account

    If you're having problems logging in to your Proton Account, learn more about common issues and how to fix them.

    1. Support
    2. Proton Account
    3. Get help
    4. Sign up and login issues

    Common signup problems and solutions

    Creating an account with Proton Mail usually takes less than 30 seconds. Learn how to successfully create a Proton Mail account

    1. Support
    2. Proton Account
    3. Get help
    4. Sign up and login issues

    How to use multiple Proton Accounts in different browser tabs

    If you have more than one Proton Account, it's easy to open multiple Proton Accounts in different browser tabs. Learn how.

    1. Support
    2. Proton Account
    3. Get help
    4. Blocking and abuse

    What to do if an online company blocks registration with Proton Mail addresses

    If an online service prevents you from registering with a Proton Mail address, heres what you can do.

    1. Support
    2. Proton Account
    3. Get help
    4. Blocking and abuse

    Proton Mail temporarily locked my account for security reasons

    If we think your account has been compromised, Proton Mail may temporarily lock it as a precaution. Follow these steps to unlock it.

    1. Support
    2. Proton Account
    3. Get help
    4. Blocking and abuse

    Proton Account disabled for abuse or fraud

    If you believe your Proton Account has been disabled by mistake, you can contact our Anti-abuse Team to get it enabled again.

    1. Support
    2. Proton Account
    3. Get help
    4. Blocking and abuse

    Proton Mail sending limits

    Learn about Proton Mails sending limits, how you can increase that limit, and what may cause a sending ban on your account.

    1. Support
    2. Proton Account
    3. Get help
    4. Blocking and abuse

    Temporarily cannot log in to Proton products

    To protect against malicious actors, we occasionally deny access to accounts that have shown suspicious activity. We explain what to do if this happens to you.
